title: Matplotlib backend issue on Windows
body:
Thanks so much for coming here to raise an issue. Please take a moment to 'check' the below boxes:

- [x ] I'm up-to-date with the latest release:
    
      pip install -U talos

- [ ] I've confirmed that my Keras model works outside of Talos.

If you still have an error, please submit **complete trace** and a code with: 

- output of shape for x and y e.g. (212,12)
- Talos params dictionary
- The Keras model wired for Talos
- Description of extra variables in the model

You can provide the code in pastebin / gist or any other format you like. 
I've following code segment. https://pastebin.com/QCaXGQt0 when I'm running the code through the python console. It get exit without any errors.

Output
PS C:\Work\PycharmProjects\Predictor\detection> python3.exe .\nn_with_param_optimizer.py -V
C:\Python36\lib\site-packages\chances\plots.py:7: UserWarning:
This call to matplotlib.use() has no effect because the backend has already
been chosen; matplotlib.use() must be called *before* pylab, matplotlib.pyplot,
or matplotlib.backends is imported for the first time.

The backend was *originally* set to 'TkAgg' by the following code:
  File ".\nn_with_param_optimizer.py", line 4, in <module>
    import talos as ta
  File "C:\Python36\lib\site-packages\talos\__init__.py", line 2, in <module>
    from .scan.Scan import Scan
  File "C:\Python36\lib\site-packages\talos\scan\Scan.py", line 1, in <module>
    from .scan_prepare import scan_prepare
  File "C:\Python36\lib\site-packages\talos\scan\scan_prepare.py", line 3, in <module>
    from ..utils.validation_split import validation_split
  File "C:\Python36\lib\site-packages\talos\utils\validation_split.py", line 2, in <module>
    from wrangle import shuffle
  File "C:\Python36\lib\site-packages\wrangle\__init__.py", line 24, in <module>
    from .ols_corr import ols_corr
  File "C:\Python36\lib\site-packages\wrangle\ols_corr.py", line 3, in <module>
    import statsmodels.api as sm
  File "C:\Python36\lib\site-packages\statsmodels\api.py", line 40, in <module>
    from .multivariate.factor import Factor
  File "C:\Python36\lib\site-packages\statsmodels\multivariate\factor.py", line 15, in <module>
    import matplotlib.pyplot
  File "C:\Python36\lib\site-packages\matplotlib\pyplot.py", line 71, in <module>
    from matplotlib.backends import pylab_setup
  File "C:\Python36\lib\site-packages\matplotlib\backends\__init__.py", l

-------------------------------------------------------------------------
